bullets: Candidate demonstrated strong analytical frameworks and structured thinking throughout the interview [e_000001].
Showed excellent ability to break down complex product problems into actionable investigation steps [e_000005].
Communication was clear and concise with good use of real-world examples [e_000002].

highlights: Strong command of product frameworks (Kano model, impact/effort matrix)
risks: Limited discussion of cross-functional collaboration challenges

strengths.text: Demonstrated product leadership by describing how they grew DAU 10x and led an 8-person engineering team [e_000001].

risks.text: Did not elaborate on how they handle pushback from senior stakeholders or navigate organizational politics [e_000003].

actions.text: In follow-up interviews, probe for examples of leading through influence without direct authority.

strengths.text: Showed collaborative mindset by emphasizing data-driven discussions and phased approaches when working with engineering [e_000003].

risks.text: Examples were focused on PM-Engineering collaboration; did not discuss working with design, marketing, or sales [e_000003].

actions.text: Ask about cross-functional alignment in product launches and how they handle conflicting priorities across teams.

strengths.text: Excellent analytical framework for investigating metric drops — systematic segmentation approach with clear hypothesis testing [e_000005].

risks.text: Did not discuss statistical significance or how to validate hypotheses with A/B testing [e_000005].

actions.text: Probe deeper on experiment design and how they quantify the impact of product changes.

strengths.text: Highly structured responses — used frameworks (Kano model, impact/effort) to organize thinking before diving into details [e_000002].

risks.text: Answers sometimes ran long; could benefit from more concise initial framing before elaboration [e_000004].

actions.text: Practice the 'headline first' approach — state the conclusion, then provide supporting details.

strengths.text: Proactively asked insightful questions about team structure and PM autonomy, showing genuine interest [e_000007].

risks.text: Could have been more proactive in proposing follow-up actions during the analytical question [e_000006].

actions.text: In future interviews, end each answer with a proposed next step or action item.

strengths: Strong analytical frameworks and structured problem-solving
risks: Could be more concise in initial responses
actions: Probe leadership through influence in next round
